description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1kbmr","text":"This protocol describes how to sample dental calculus from individual teeth for optical microscopy analysis. The primary use-case is for the analysis of dental micro-remains embedded in the matrix of the dental calculus (e.g. starches, phytoliths, pollens, fungi, fibers, etc.), though it can also be used for biomolecular analysis (DNA and proteomics).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: FCT - Fundação para a Ciência e a Tecnologia (PhD Studentship)
FCT - Fundação para a Ciência e Tecnologia

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1e4o3","text":"A clean sterile sampling environment is a vital factor to reduce contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aulb3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c0pc","text":"Gloves should be worn during the whole sampling procedure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: dental calculus, sampling, archaeobotany, archaeology, bioarchaeology, bioanthropology, teeth, dental remains, dental anthropology, skeleton, light microscopy
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"5co1u","text":"Powder-free nitrile gloves","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mgnj","text":"Aluminum foil","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"een1d","text":"Plastic wrap","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pshc","text":"Alcohol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61mj4","text":"Paper towels","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4drar","text":"Sterile disposable blades","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o2ol","text":"Centrifuge tubes (1.5 or 2 ml)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jb9g","text":"Centrifuge tube storage and transport box","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqaim","text":"Precision scale","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q04q","text":"Vernier caliper","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89u2f","text":"Magnifying lens (tube/bag labeling)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctla9","text":"Sharpie","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqvla","text":"Camera and scale","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7bjh","text":"Metadata sheet (including Sampling ID; Collection ID; Burial/Tooth ID; Tooth FDI Code; Surface; Pathologies; Other Notes)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: Recording dental caries in archaeological human remains
Patterns of molar wear in hunter–gatherers and agriculturalists
Standards for Data Collection from Human Skeletal Remains: Proceedings of a Seminar at the Field Museum of Natural History organized by Jonathan Haas
references.authors: Jane E. Buikstra and Douglas H. Ubelaker

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ccunv","text":"Display aluminum foil on the working table and carefully collect the dental calculus deposit using a sterile disposable blade and under the magnifying lens","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"besil","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br54n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"efseo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1gaf8","text":"Be careful not to scratch the enamel/tooth surface with the tip of the disposable blade.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eq0cd","text":"Clean the working table surface using alcohol and paper towels, and use powder-free nitrile gloves throughout the whole steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3vf90","text":"Make sure to sterilize all utensils used before starting the sample collection and between sampling each tooth. Use alcohol and the paper towels","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7o8p3","text":"Fill in the metadata sheet with all the information and the corresponding tubes IDs. Record the dental pathologies (Hillson, 2001), dental wear (Smith, 1984) and describe the deposit of dental calculus accordingly to its type and size (Buikstra and Ubelaker, 1994)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0asu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97skv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqafh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnane","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aas31","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fre2d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"36ccv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d6kn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1hu3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8in2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e4714","text":"For tooth numbering, use the FDI system.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Simon Hillson","can_edit":true,"date":993945600,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1002/oa.538","guid":"A2EBB6C0FBE611ED85049F1B068DA441","id":2311,"journal":"Int. J. Osteoarchaeol., 11: 249-289","protocol_id":null,"title":"Recording dental caries in archaeological human remains"}},"2":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"B. Holly Smith","can_edit":true,"date":441763200,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1002/ajpa.1330630107","guid":"1941E740FBE711ED85049F1B068DA441","id":2312,"journal":"Am. J. Phys. Anthropol., 63: 39-56","protocol_id":null,"title":"Patterns of molar wear in hunter–gatherers and agriculturalists"}},"3":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Jane E. Buikstra and Douglas H. Ubelaker","can_edit":true,"date":757382400,"doi":"ISBN 1-56349-075-7","guid":"B0D57630FBE711ED85049F1B068DA441","id":2313,"journal":"","protocol_id":null,"title":"Standards for Data Collection from Human Skeletal Remains: Proceedings of a Seminar at the Field Museum of Natural History organized by Jonathan Haas"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"clmsa","text":"Measure the dental calculus deposits using the Vernier caliper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1lcja","text":"Photograph the tooth surfaces before collecting the dental calculus deposit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dmjrn","text":"Put the sample in the labelled centrifuge tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f8ur","text":"Take new photos of the tooth after the collection of the dental calculus deposit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqskj","text":"Take control samples of the working table surface (and other relevant surfaces) and maxillary bone (if present) to cross-out possible contamination","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
